titleStmt.title: The manifest of the most illustrious, and soveraigne prince, Charles Lodovvick, Count Palatine of the Rhine, Prince Electour of the sacred Empire: Duke of Bavaria, &c. Concerning the right of his succession both in the princedome, lands, and estates of the Palatinate: as also in the dignity, voice, session, and function of the electorship-Palatine thereunto annexed. Translated, anno. M.DC.XXXVII.
Manifestum sive deductio. English
titleStmt.author: Karl Ludwig, Elector Palatine, 1617-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A[nne] G[riffin] for I[oyce] N[orton] and R[ichard] W[hitaker] And are to be sold at the signe of the Kings Armes in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Manifestum sive deductio.
Printer's and publishers' names from STC.

STC reports copies with additional text with heading "An advertisement to the reader", collating chi¹ ("A2") B-H⁴ I¹, referring to the present manifesto. G2 has separate title page, "The protestation [..?]. London, 1637" (formerly STC 5049), followed by a different (earlier?) version of "A protestation of the most high and mighty prince Charles Lodowicke".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: the signe of the Kings Armes in Pauls Church-yard
